intro: Comesperma acerosum, commonly known as the rough comesperma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It produces woody capsules as its fruit, which contain small, hard seeds. Comesperma acerosum is often found in heathlands and open forests, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
